1. Homemade Rice water - highly nutritious, easy to digest, energy booster, soothing and helps with weaning too. 2. Homemade Rice Porridge  3. Best advice I can give you if your goingto make baby food. Buy a baby food maker. I made all my daughters food. You can make the same thing you are making but in her food maker with no salt. And in 20 min you have food. First food: avocado, it is the closest to the nutrition of breast milk. Also introduce one new food per week. My daughter's fav combos: parsnip and pears and mango and yams. Also cook with herbs, onions and garlic as she is older. (1 year) I hope these little tips help!
other great combo: broccoli and sweet potato. I did everything in batches in the Thermomix and froze a lot of it in ice cube trays.

Iâ€™d highly recommend looking into baby led weaning. Basically you sit baby at the table with you and let her watch how you eat, and babies copy, so sheâ€™ll learn how to chew and such like a pro! And then you just feed her exactly what youâ€™re eating just cut up into bite sized pieces or fry shaped pieces so she can gnaw on it, and itâ€™s amazing! So much more simple then making baby special food, and itâ€™s SO MUCH FUN to see her reaction to everything! Not to mention they love it too!

I think every informed mom nowadays knows about baby led weaning:) It's just not for everyone. It's still very nice of you to explain this, for anyone who wouldn't know and is reading the comments. I did a mix (which I know is controversial) and my babies loved it too!
